title: BC Piping Ethanol not firing the engine.
description:
The Diesel generator doesn't seem to kickstart on BC pipe ethanol feed, the fuel just keeps accumulating and doesn't produce energy.

After pumping the fuel out (you can see the pipe is on the other direction now), and feeding it a can of ethanol/coalfuel/else, it works properly.

http://i.imgur.com/VD8gloA.png

Worth noting?

replies.body: And it works off of pumped ethanol after you've shoved a can of it in?

Note the importance between CAN and CELL in this comment.

Wire Diesel Generator (DG) to empty out-of-grid MFE.

TEST 1
- Put a can of biomass in the IN chamber of DG, loads liquid, doesn't start
- When liquid is loaded a coloured square will appear in the fuel tank of the DG.
- Put an empty can in the IN chamber of DG, unloads liquid into can.
TEST 2
- Put a can of ethanol in the IN chamber of DG, loads liquid, doesn't start
- Put an empty can in the IN chamber of DG, unloads ethanol into can.
TEST 3
- Put a can of ethanol in the IN chamber of DG, loads liquid, doesn't start
- Put an empty cell in the IN chamber of DG, doesn't load liquid.
TEST 4
- Pump Ethanol into DG. Liquid acumulates on bar, doesn't start.
- Put empty cans in the IN chamber of DG. Only drains in full sets of 1.000 mB. The odd amount is left in the DG.
- Wrench it out and replace it.
- Put ethanol CELL in the IN chamber of DG. Liquid amount doesn't change. DG starts, instead of an orange ethanol square in the fuel tank, an intermitent fire symbol appears.
- After outputting ~127.000 EU into the MFE, turns off.
- Pump ethanol in. Doesn't Start. Fuel counts: iquid amount 3.879
- Drain the MFE.
- With ethanol in the fuel tank, put a fuel CELL in the IN Chamber of the DG. Starts.
- After outputting ~127.000 EU into the MFE, DG turns off. Fuel indicator still showing 3.879
I simply don't seem able to put Forestry liquids into CELL.

Last test.
Put 3 cells of ethanol in IN chamber, Liquid amount still 3.879.
Immediatly one cell is emptied and put in OUT, DG starts churning EU. Liquid amount doesn't change.

I think it doesn't work :·D
Report this on the main thread, this is buggy.  Might be a bit of inconsistency with Fluids.
